t: 2 Samuel 22
David’s Song of Deliverance
And*p David spoke to the Lord*s the words of this song on the day when the Lord*s delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul.
He said, “The*pn Lord*s is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer,
my*ld God, my rock, in whom I take refuge, my*ln shield, and the horn of my salvation, my*ld stronghold and my refuge, my*ld savior; you save me from violence.
I*ln call upon the Lord,*s who is worthy to be praised, and*ld I am saved from my enemies.
“For*pn the waves of death encompassed me, the*ld torrents of destruction assailed me;
the*ln cords of Sheol entangled me; the*ld snares of death confronted me.
“In*pn my distress I called upon the Lord;*s to*ld my God I called. From*ln his temple he heard my voice, and*ld my cry came to his ears.
“Then*pn the earth reeled and rocked; the*ld foundations of the heavens trembled and*ld quaked, because he was angry.
Smoke*ln went up from his nostrils, and*ld devouring fire from his mouth; glowing*ld coals flamed forth from him.
He*ln bowed the heavens and came down; thick*ld darkness was under his feet.
He*ln rode on a cherub and flew; he*ld was seen on the wings of the wind.
He*ln made darkness around him his canopy, thick*ld clouds, a gathering of water.
Out*ln of the brightness before him coals*ld of fire flamed forth.
The*ln Lord*s thundered from heaven, and*ld the Most High uttered his voice.
And*ln he sent out arrows and scattered them; lightning,*ld and routed them.
Then*ln the channels of the sea were seen; the*ld foundations of the world were laid bare, at*ln the rebuke of the Lord,*s at*ld the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
“He*pn sent from on high, he took me; he*ld drew me out of many waters.
He*ln rescued me from my strong enemy, from*ld those who hated me, for*ld they were too mighty for me.
They*ln confronted me in the day of my calamity, but*ld the Lord*s was my support.
He*ln brought me out into a broad place; he*ld rescued me, because he delighted in me.
“The*pn Lord*s dealt with me according to my righteousness; according*ld to the cleanness of my hands he rewarded me.
For*ln I have kept the ways of the Lord*s and*ld have not wickedly departed from my God.
For*ln all his rules were before me, and*ld from his statutes I did not turn aside.
I*ln was blameless before him, and*ld I kept myself from guilt.
And*ln the Lord*s has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according*ld to my cleanness in his sight.
“With*pn the merciful you show yourself merciful; with*ld the blameless man you show yourself blameless;
with*ln the purified you deal purely, and*ld with the crooked you make yourself seem tortuous.

“For*pn who is God, but the Lord?*s And*ld who is a rock, except our God?
